Description: A fragment of ivory: possibly part of a box, with an incised design on one side, showing two figures of bearded captives offering vases. The figures are set one above the other in two registers. The surface of the ivory has decayed and the fragment has been restored from three smaller pieces.
Curator's comments: Bears excavator's mark B. Compare with W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl. IV, 6. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls. IIIA, 2 and IV, 15 (each showing only a part of the object. See also P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit I (Wiesbaden, 1963), 208; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit II (Wiesbaden, 1964), 901, n. 1183, where the object is incorrectly equated with Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl. IIIA, I.
